00040 
00041 // Some machines (sparc) dont support unaligned memory access
00042 // The mmaped files are chock full of unaligned accesses.
00043 // When AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW is defined we will do the 
00044 // alignment in software.
00045 // This feature can be enabled on intel for testing.
00046 
00047 // This is here to enable this feature automaticly on the sparc and ppc.
00048 // they cant do unaligned loads.
00049 #ifdef __sparc__
00050 #define AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW
00051 #endif
00052 #ifdef __POWERPC__
00053 #define AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 using namespace std;

00058 void
00059 ReadUInt32_I(IFSTREAM& instr, uint32_t& val) 
00060 {
00061   uint32_t v=0;
00062   instr.read((char*)&v,sizeof(v));
00063   val=itohl(v);
00064 }
00065 void
00066 ReadInt32_I(IFSTREAM& instr,int32_t& val) 
00067 {
00068   ReadUInt32_I(instr,(uint32_t&)val);
00069 }
00070 void
00071 ReadFloat_I(IFSTREAM& instr,float& val) 
00072 {
00073   ReadUInt32_I(instr,(uint32_t&)val);
00074 }
00075 //
00076 void
00077 ReadUInt16_I(IFSTREAM& instr, uint16_t& val) 
00078 {
00079   uint16_t v=0;
00080   instr.read((char*)&v,sizeof(v));
00081   val=itohs(v);
00082 }
00083 void
00084 ReadInt16_I(IFSTREAM& instr,int16_t& val) 
00085 {
00086   ReadUInt16_I(instr,(uint16_t&)val);
00087 }
00088 
00089 // No byte swapping needed.
00090 void
00091 ReadUInt8(IFSTREAM& instr, uint8_t& val) 
00092 {
00093   instr.read((char*)&val,sizeof(val));
00094 }
00095 void
00096 ReadInt8(IFSTREAM& instr,int8_t& val) 
00097 {
00098   ReadUInt8(instr,(uint8_t&)val);
00099 }

00136 
00137 // When the old BPMAP files were written, the output 
00138 // values were mangled in this way:
00139 // * Start with a float value.
00140 // * convert it to an integer.
00141 // * byte-swap it
00142 // * write it as a float.
00143 // This function reverses the process to get the data.
00144 void
00145 ReadFloatFromOldBPMAP_N(IFSTREAM &instr, float &fval)
00146 {
00147   type_punned pun;
00148 
00149         instr.read((char *)&pun.v_uint32,FLOAT_SIZE);
00150 #if BYTE_ORDER == BIG_ENDIAN
00151   pun.v_uint32=affy_swap32(pun.v_uint32);
00152   pun.v_uint32=(uint32_t)pun.v_float;
00153   pun.v_uint32=affy_swap32(pun.v_uint32);
00154 #else
00155   pun.v_uint32=(uint32_t)pun.v_float;
00156   pun.v_uint32=ntohl(pun.v_uint32);
00157 #endif
00158   fval=pun.v_uint32;
00159 }

00176 void
00177 ReadCString_I(IFSTREAM& instr, char*& str)
00178 {
00179   uint32_t slen;
00180   ReadUInt32_I(instr,slen);
00181   str=new char[slen+1];
00182   instr.read(str,slen);
00183   // ensure null -- this replaces the last char read.
00184   str[slen]=0; 
00185 }
00186 
00187 void
00188 ReadCharacterArray(IFSTREAM& instr, char* str, uint32_t len)
00189 {
00190   instr.read(str,len);
00191 }
00192 
00193 // The data file may or may not have the null terminator as
00194 // part of the length. Using a STD::STRING function as the buffer to
00195 // read directly into may result in the string with a length one more
00196 // than is intended. The CHAR * buffer will contain an extra null that
00197 // will get removed when copying to the output STD::STRING.
00198 void
00199 ReadFixedString(IFSTREAM& instr, string& str, uint32_t len)
00200 {
00201   char *s = new char[len+1];
00202   instr.read(s,len);
00203   s[len]=0;
00204   str = s;
00205   delete[] s;
00206 }
00207 
00208 void
00209 ReadString_I(IFSTREAM& instr, string& str)
00210 {
00211   uint32_t len;
00212   ReadUInt32_I(instr,len);
00213   ReadFixedString(instr,str,len);
00214 }
00215 
00216 void
00217 ReadUIntLenString_I(IFSTREAM& instr, std::string &s)
00218 {
00219         uint32_t len;
00220         ReadUInt32_I(instr, len);
00221         ReadFixedString(instr, s, len);
00222 }
00223 
00224 void
00225 ReadCString_N(IFSTREAM& instr, char*& str)
00226 {
00227   uint32_t slen;
00228   ReadUInt32_N(instr,slen);
00229   str=new char[slen+1];
00230   instr.read(str,slen);
00231   // ensure null -- this replaces the last char read.
00232   str[slen]=0; 
00233 }

00235 void
00236 ReadString_N(IFSTREAM& instr, string& str)
00237 {
00238   uint32_t len;
00239   ReadUInt32_N(instr,len);
00240   ReadFixedString(instr,str,len);
00241 }

00243 void
00244 ReadUIntLenString_N(IFSTREAM& instr, std::string &s)
00245 {
00246         uint32_t len;
00247         ReadUInt32_N(instr, len);
00248         ReadFixedString(instr, s, len);
00249 }

00251 void 
00252 ReadNextLine(IFSTREAM& instr,char* line,int len)
00253 {
00254         strcpy(line,"");
00255         while (!instr.eof())
00256         {
00257                 instr.getline(line,len);
00258                 if (strlen(line)>0)
00259                 {
00260                         if (line[strlen(line)-1]=='\r')
00261                                 line[strlen(line)-1]='\0';
00262                         if (strlen(line)>0)
00263                                 return;
00264                 }
00265         }
00266 }

00269 //==============================
00270 //
00271 
00272 // There are two issues here: alignment and byte order.  
00273 // Byte order can be handled with the "htoi" functions.
00274 // Alignment has to be handled with functions.
00275 
00276 // The "Get*" functions are for reading data from a mem-mapped file.
00277 // OLD: Callers of these really should use "itoh*" directly.
00278 //      Opps! They cant as "itoh" does not handle aligment.
00279 
00280 // The signed versions
00281 int32_t 
00282 MmGetInt32_I(int32_t* ptr)
00283 {
00284   return MmGetUInt32_I((uint32_t*)ptr);
00285 }
00286 int16_t 
00287 MmGetInt16_I(int16_t* ptr)
00288 {
00289   return MmGetUInt16_I((uint16_t*)ptr);
00290 }
00291 int32_t 
00292 MmGetInt32_N(int32_t* ptr)
00293 {
00294   return MmGetUInt32_N((uint32_t*)ptr);
00295 }
00296 int16_t 
00297 MmGetInt16_N(int16_t* ptr)
00298 {
00299   return MmGetUInt16_N((uint16_t*)ptr);
00300 }
00301 int8_t 
00302 MmGetInt8(int8_t* ptr)
00303 {
00304   return MmGetUInt8((uint8_t*)ptr);

00376   return pun.v_float;

00384   *ptr=pun.v_float;

00402 
00403 // See the notes in 
00404 float
00405 MmGetFloatFromOldBPMAP_N(float *ptr)
00406 {
00407   float fval;
00408 
00409 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00410   // There isnt any punning going on here.
00411   // cast, swap, cast back.
00412         fval = (float)ntohl((uint32_t)*ptr);
00413 #else
00414   type_punned pun;
00415   pun.v_float=*ptr;
00416   pun.v_uint32=affy_swap32(pun.v_uint32);
00417         fval=(float)affy_swap32((uint32_t)pun.v_float);
00418 #endif
00419   return fval;
00420 }
00421 
00422 #endif
00423 
00424 // We dont have unaligned access to memory, fake it
00425 // The conversion from and to little endian is done as part of
00426 // the unaligned mem access
00427 
00428 #ifdef AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW
00429 
00431 uint32_t
00432 MmGetUInt32_I(uint32_t* ptr)
00433 {
00434   uint8_t* cptr=(uint8_t*)ptr;
00435   uint32_t val=0;
00436   val|=(*cptr++);
00437   val|=(*cptr++)<< 8;
00438   val|=(*cptr++)<<16;
00439   val|=(*cptr++)<<24;
00440   return val;
00441 }
00442 void
00443 MmSetUInt32_I(uint32_t* ptr,uint32_t val)
00444 {
00445   uint8_t* cptr=(uint8_t*)ptr;
00446   *cptr++=((val    )&0xFF);
00447   *cptr++=((val>> 8)&0xFF);
00448   *cptr++=((val>>16)&0xFF);
00449   *cptr++=((val>>24)&0xFF);
00450 }
00451 
00452 uint32_t
00453 MmGetUInt32_N(uint32_t* ptr)
00454 {
00455   uint8_t* cptr=(uint8_t*)ptr;
00456   uint32_t val=0;
00457   val|=(*cptr++)<<24;
00458   val|=(*cptr++)<<16;
00459   val|=(*cptr++)<< 8;
00460   val|=(*cptr++);
00461   return val;
00462 }
00463 void
00464 MmSetUInt32_N(uint32_t* ptr,uint32_t val)
00465 {
00466   uint8_t* cptr=(uint8_t*)ptr;
00467   // val=htonl(val); // with it in big order
00468   *cptr++=((val>>24)&0xFF);
00469   *cptr++=((val>>16)&0xFF);
00470   *cptr++=((val>> 8)&0xFF);
00471   *cptr++=((val    )&0xFF);
00472 }
00473

00480   val|=(*cptr++);
00481   val|=(*cptr++)<<8;
00482   return val;

00485 MmSetUInt16_I(uint16_t* ptr,uint16_t val)

00489   *cptr++=((val>> 8)&0xFF);
00490 }

00497   val|=(*cptr++);
00498   return val;

00500 void
00501 MmSetUInt16_N(uint16_t* ptr,uint16_t val)
00502 {
00503   uint8_t* cptr=(uint8_t*)ptr;
00504   *cptr++=((val>>8)&0xFF);
00505   *cptr++=((val   )&0xFF);
00506 }

00538 float
00539 MmGetFloatFromOldBPMAP_N(float *ptr)
00540 {
00541         float fval;
00542 #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN
00543         fval = (float) ntohl((uint32_t)MmGetFloat_I(ptr));
00544 #else
00545         int i1=*(int *)ptr;
00546         i1=affy_swap32(i1);
00548         fval=(float)affy_swap32((uint32_t)(*(float *)&i1)); // cast to float, then deref
00549 #endif
00550         return fval;
00551 }
00552 
00553 void
00554 MmSetFloat_N(float* ptr,float val)
00555 {
00556   MmSetUInt32_N((uint32_t*)ptr,*(uint32_t*)&val);
00557 }
00558 #endif
